metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Python JSON
JSON is a syntax for storing and exchanging data.
content.html: JSON is a syntax for storing and exchanging data.

content.text: JSON is text, written with JavaScript object notation.
content.html: JSON is text, written with JavaScript object notation.

content.text: JSON in Python
Python has a built-in package called json , which can be used to work with JSON data.
content.html: Python has a built-in package called json, which can be used to work with JSON data.

content.code_html: import json

content.text: Parse JSON - Convert from JSON to Python
If you have a JSON string, you can parse it by using the json.loads() method.
content.html: If you have a JSON string, you can parse it by using the json.loads() method.

content.text: The result will be a Python dictionary .
content.html: The result will be a Python dictionary.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
import json# some JSON:x =  '{ "name":"John", "age":30, "city":"New 
  York"}'# parse x:y = json.loads(x)# the result is a 
  Python dictionary:print(y["age"])

# the result is a 
  Python dictionary:

content.code:
import json# some JSON:x =  '{ "name":"John", "age":30, "city":"New
York"}'# parse x:y = json.loads(x)# the result is a
Python dictionary:print(y["age"])

syntax_highlighting.text:
import json# some JSON:x =  '{ "name":"John", "age":30, "city":"New 
  York"}'# parse x:y = json.loads(x)# the result is a 
  Python dictionary:print(y["age"])

# the result is a 
  Python dictionary:

content.code_html:
import json

# some JSON:
x =  '{ "name":"John", "age":30, "city":"New York"}'

# parse x:
y = json.loads(x)

# the result is a Python dictionary:
print(y["age"])

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
import json# some JSON:x =  '{ "name":"John", "age":30, "city":"New 
  York"}'# parse x:y = json.loads(x)# the result is a 
  Python dictionary:print(y["age"])

# the result is a 
  Python dictionary:

content.text: Convert from Python to JSON
If you have a Python object, you can convert it into a JSON string by using the json.dumps() method.
content.html: If you have a Python object, you can convert it into a JSON string by using the json.dumps() method.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
import json# a Python object (dict):x = {  "name": 
  "John",  "age": 30,  "city": "New York"}# 
  convert into JSON:y = json.dumps(x)# the result is a JSON string:
  print(y)
# the result is a JSON string:

content.code:
import json# a Python object (dict):x = {  "name":
"John",  "age": 30,  "city": "New York"}#
convert into JSON:y = json.dumps(x)# the result is a JSON string:
print(y)

syntax_highlighting.text:
import json# a Python object (dict):x = {  "name": 
 "John",  "age": 30,  "city": "New York"}# 
  convert into JSON:y = json.dumps(x)# the result is a JSON string:
 print(y)
# the result is a JSON string:

content.code_html:
import json

# a Python object (dict):
x = {
  "name": "John",
  "age": 30,
  "city": "New York"
}

# convert into JSON:
y = json.dumps(x)

# the result is a JSON string:
 print(y)

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
import json# a Python object (dict):x = {  "name": 
  "John",  "age": 30,  "city": "New York"}# 
  convert into JSON:y = json.dumps(x)# the result is a JSON string:
  print(y)
# the result is a JSON string:

content.text: You can convert Python objects of the following types, into JSON strings:
content.html: You can convert Python objects of the following types, into JSON strings:

content.code_html:
import json

print(json.dumps({"name": "John", "age": 30}))
print(json.dumps(["apple", "bananas"]))
print(json.dumps(("apple", "bananas")))
print(json.dumps("hello"))
print(json.dumps(42))
print(json.dumps(31.76))
print(json.dumps(True))
print(json.dumps(False))
print(json.dumps(None))

content.text: When you convert from Python to JSON, Python objects are converted into the JSON (JavaScript) equivalent:
content.html: When you convert from Python to JSON, Python objects are converted into the JSON (JavaScript) equivalent:

content.code_html:
import json

x = {
  "name": "John",
  "age": 30,
  "married": True,
  "divorced": False,
  "children": ("Ann","Billy"),
  "pets": None,
  "cars": [
    {"model": "BMW 230", "mpg": 27.5},
    {"model": "Ford Edge", "mpg": 24.1}
  ]
}

print(json.dumps(x))

content.text: Format the Result
The example above prints a JSON string, but it is not very easy to read, with no indentations and line breaks.
content.html: The example above prints a JSON string, but it is not very easy to read, with no indentations and line breaks.

content.text: The json.dumps() method has parameters to make it easier to read the result:
content.html: The json.dumps() method has parameters to make it easier to read the result:

content.code_html: json.dumps(x, indent=4)

content.text: You can also define the separators, default value is (", ", ": "), which means using a comma and a space to separate each object, and a colon and a space to separate keys from values:
content.html: You can also define the separators, default value is (", ", ": "), which means using a comma and a space to separate each object, and a colon and a space to separate keys from values:

content.code_html: json.dumps(x, indent=4, separators=(". ", " = "))

content.text: Order the Result
The json.dumps() method has parameters to order the keys in the result:
content.html: The json.dumps() method has parameters to order the keys in the result:

content.code_html: json.dumps(x, indent=4, sort_keys=True)

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
When you parse code with the json.loads() method, the result is returned as a specific Python data type, which one?
content.html: When you parse code with the json.loads() method, the result is returned as a specific Python data type, which one?
